location.physicalLocation: British Library: India Office Records and Private Papers

titleInfo.title: ‘File 13/30 Flight regulations in Persian Gulf States’

physicalDescription.extent: The file’s contents are arranged in approximate chronological order, from the earliest item at the front to the latest at the end. The file notes at the end of the file (f 11) mirror the chronological arrangement.

Foliation: the foliation sequence commences at the front cover and terminates at the inside back cover; these numbers are written in pencil, are circled, and are located in the top right corner of the recto side of each folio.

mods.abstract: The file contains copies of telegrams, sent from His Majesty’s Ambassador in Baghdad, relating to flight regulation changes made in the Persian Gulf and wider Middle East region: A telegram dated 29 May 1948 (f 2) informs of prohibition and restrictions of entry into airspace above Egypt and Palestine. A telegram dated 1 June 1948 (f 3) announces the prohibition of night-time flying over all areas of Iraq. A telegram dated 28 June 1948 (f 4) informs of changes in radio frequency operation in Iraq. A telegram dated 6 September (f 6), informs of changes at Baghdad airport while repair work was undertaken on the main runway. A telegram dated 8 November 1948 (f 9) offers practical advice for aircraft landing at Baghdad.
